Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively fine and pinkish in section, the outer surfaces are covered with a burnished red slip, the interior bears faint traces of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, much of the slip on the exterior has been worn away.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394417) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394417)
